1.content:
So, which Fairy Tail girl is going to be having a misadventure today?

Lucy Heartfilia
http://fairytail.wikia.com/wiki/Lucy_Hea...
Fairy Tail's Celestial Spirit Mage is upbeat and positive and, like every member of Fairy Tail, loyal to her friends. Though booksmart, she is also outgoing, if somewhat clumsy. Lucy has been no stranger to wardrobe malfunctions during her time at Fairy Tail, not that she enjoys that aspect of the guild. Her magic enables her to call helpful spirits to her aid via the use of keys she holds. She views all of her spirits as her friends.

Erza Scarlet
http://fairytail.wikia.com/wiki/Erza_Sca...
One of Fairy Tail's strongest wizards, Erza holds the rank of S-Class, one of only four in the guild who currently hold that title. Though she may appear rigid and stern on the outside, in hides a much softer side of her personality that loves her friends, sweets and many other things girly. Her magic allows her to instantaneously replace any magic weapon or armor she is currently using. This is called requipping. She is extremely adept at almost all kinds of physical combat, to the degree of sometimes frightening her guildmates.

Wendy Marvell
http://fairytail.wikia.com/wiki/Wendy_Ma...
One of Fairy Tail's youngest wizards, Wendy is also one of the guild's three first generation Dragon Slayers, which means she was raised by an actual dragon and taught its magic. Wendy is bright, cheerful (if a bit shy) and intensely mindful of others, always putting their needs before her own. Her magic, Sky Dragon Slayer Magic, is mostly support-based, capable of healing her friends and enhancing their abilities, though she does have a few offensive options as well.

Juvia Lockser
http://fairytail.wikia.com/wiki/Juvia_Lo...
Though originally a member of the guild Phantom Lord, Juvia joined Fairy Tail after that guild's dissolution. Her primary motivation for joining Fairy Tail, and indeed her primary motivation for most things in her life, is an extreme obsession with Fairy Tail's ice make mage, Gray Fullbuster, with whom she fought and then was saved by. She has since fallen madly in love with him and bases most of her daily life around him. He is somewhat perturbed by this. Juvia's magic allows for very strong control over water, to the point of even making herself water if she wishes.

122.content:
"Dodge left!" Erza bellowed to Lucy as a freeze bullet came towards her. Lucy was just short of the task; as she dove right the magic struck her lower left leg.

Lucy winced as she landed. Erza landed from her short flight and her face darkened at her immediate foe who had injured her teammate.

The team they were fighting were called the Gelid Sisters. Whether they were actual family or not was unknown. Lucy had already noted by their matching appearance--navy-colored sailor-like school uniforms with their hair styled into a horn--that they were almost certainly members of a resurgent Dark Unicorn guild.

The Gelids are magic gunslingers like Alzack and Bisca. They don't go too much for style, relying on their magic motorcycles' speed and guns' firepower to complete their missions, which are usually theft, property destruction, or kidnapping.

The group's bossy leader was Coryza. She had long blue hair, a slender form, and wielded a bazooka that prevented its target from using magic. Pruina was the quick-tempered one. She had a dark complexion, a stout build, and carried an assault rifle that shot bullets freezing the perception of time. Finally, there was the apathetic Algu. She had spiky, silver hair, an athletic physique, and held a derringer-like firearm which bullets were like local paralyzers.

"You dare harm a member of Fairy Tail!" Erza shouted to Algu. Meanwhile, Taurus had finally caught Pruina, sliced her weapon in two with his ax, and knocked her down with the ax's broadside.

Algu scratched her hair while Erza changed from Adamantine Armor to Flight Armor. "You... like, harmed Coryza first," Algu said and reloaded with amazing speed.

Algu was right. Lucy's semi-successful plan was having Gemini pose as Coryza to confuse and divide the Gelid Sisters. Unfortunately, Gemini tried to join the group before Coryza had left. To their credit, Gemini managed to lead the pursuing Gelid Sisters to Erza and Lucy, who formed an impromptu ambush that knocked out Coryza

The Golden Bull knelt next to Lucy. "Lucy, you weren't moooobile enough and she hit your calf. Is your perfect body harmed?"

Lucy shook her head and sat up. "No. Just my left foot, leg, and umm... half of my backside are asleep."

Taurus eyes widened and he began to rub her lower leg and work up. "Perhaps a moooosage will bring back the feeling in your--" Taurus froze as Algu shot him in the back head. Though he could not move his head or talk, his hands continuing to work their... um-hum... healing efforts up Lucy's thigh. Again, Lucy was just a hair too late and the lewd bovine got in a slight feel of her unfeeling rump.

Algu shrugged. "I didn't know if it would work on Celestial Beings. I guess I'm carrying my sisters weight. Oh well." She returned her attention to Titania just in time to evade an attack.

"Now you have two to answer for," Erza said and was just about to strike when she heard Lucy call "Duck!" Erza did as magic bullets rapidly flew overhead. They were coming from Pruina.

Pruina spit and rubbed her black eye. "So do you, floozy! And Algu--that comment about weight better not have been about me if you don't want to be target practice later!" Pruina had reequipped with an Uzi-looking magic gun and was running in an arc toward Lucy but still firing at Erza.

Erza was dodging deftly, but was now worried about Lucy. It looked like she was just about to summon another Celestial Being, so maybe she would be okay. Algu was now firing to, so Erza decided to keep the attention on her. "At least it's two against two and now three against two," she called reassuringly to Lucy who had just summoned Virgo.

Erza suddenly stop as a small magic missile hit her in the back. "You're only half-right, strumpet," said the voice behind her. "Or did you forget, there are three Gelid Sisters?"

Erza, whose Flight Armor was rapidly disappearing, turned to see Coryza, whom stood coolly preparing to reload her bazooka with a large bump poking through her blue hair. Erza tried in vain to select a different armor, but her amazing body was as bare as the day she was born.

"Now, Pruina and Algu, be sure to take care of the Celestial Being while I take care of buxom blondie here." Apparently, reloading the bazooka was its greatest disadvantage.

Virgo was receiving non-BDSM commands from an increasingly agitated Lucy while Pruina and Algu turned to their self-appointed superior. "By Frost, Coryza, it was a blessing to have you not giving us orders for a few minutes! Orders that we... already... know!" Pruina said as she rubbed her sore eye again.

"Ditto," Algu said and quickly reloaded.

"Then do them!" Coryza screamed back.

Erza felt more humiliated than any time she could remember. Having her breasts, butt, and genitalia visible to people, even those outside of Fairy Tail, was embarrassing, but nothing that would make here shriek and hide in the bushes the way Lucy probably would. But to be without her ability to use magic and in the middle of combat where it put her teammate in danger? It was worse than a thousand gawkers at close ups of her private parts.

Erza wanted to sink into the Earth like how Virgo was now. It must be like how those coeds in that one eroge story I read felt, she mused.

Then Erza remembered. One of the alleged advantages of Seduction Armor was resistance to Nullifying Attacks. She wasn't sure if this counted, but it might be worth a try. Two other thoughts that came out from the self-pity: one, grab the partly limp Lucy and try to escape with her; or two, try to fan the flames of the Gelid Sisters argument until Virgo attacks and hopefully Lucy regains mobility.

13.title: Wendy Marvell

choices: Keep Carla here and explore the island
Send Carla for help with Sally
132.content:
Wendy and Carla are flying to a remote island in the middle of semi-large inland sea. Ever since her power had grown, boats had begun to make Wendy sick, and flying was faster anyway. Their job was to investigate a team of missing employees of the Heart Kreuz fashion company, who had been on the island looking into certain plants for an interesting new form of dye that reacted to magic. The employees had been out of contact for a week and the company was beginning to get concerned, thus posting a request. This job was originally picked by Lucy, since the reward, in addition to a good chunk of Jewel, included some designer products. However, Lucy had fallen sick and Erza, who was also interested, had been called away by Jellal with an urgent message. So Wendy set out alone with the promise she'd share the spoils with her friends. Wendy liked clothes well enough, but not to the extent of those two.

         "Looks like that's it!" Wendy says, pointing down at the island below. Carla flies them down to the beach and the two land gracefully. Carla then assumes her more human form at the two survey the coastline.

         "No sign of anyone so far..." Carla says, worried. She hasn't had a specific premonition about this job, but can't shake the feeling something is wrong.

         "Yeah, and..." Wendy sniffs the air. "Something doesn't smell right. I can't put my finger on what, though..."

         The two head into the jungle for about half a mile before coming across a clearing with tents and a few per-fabricated buildings.

         "This must be the camp..." Wendy says.

         The camp seems to be in disarray. Various items have been knocked to the ground and it's apparent whoever was here left quickly. Near an overturned chair Wendy spots what looks like part of a shirt, seemingly burned at the edges. She leans down to pick it up.

         "WENDY, LOOK OUT!" Carla screams. Wendy turns and ducks just in time for a phosphorescent blue slime to lunge at her chest. Wendy dodges at the last second.

         "Ah! What is that-" But before she can finish her sentence, she feels a pull from behind. Something warm and wet on her back. Turning her head she can see one of the slimes has attached itself to her back and seems to be spreading. Without thinking, she shrugs out of her jacket and jumps away. She looks back to see her jacket fully enveloped by the slime. It dissolves quickly. Carla runs toward Wendy only to unknowingly step on one of the creatures. Her feet stick, but after a few furious tugs she frees herself, her stockinged feet emerging from the shoes, which are quickly absorbed by the creature.

         "RUN!" Wendy yells. The two make a mad dash out of the camp in a random direction, sickly squelching and rustling sounds following them close behind. Breaking in from the bush beside them, Wendy sees another slime, this one clearly in the form of a naked woman, grinning madly.

         "Come baaaaaack!" She jeers, her voice oily and strange. Wendy speeds up even more. Eventually they break through the jungle and find themselves on the beach, near a dock. Out in the water is a boat. There is a woman waving frantically, she pushes a gangway on to the dock and beckons furiously at the two wizards. Wasting no time Wendy and Carla sprint onto the dock and up the gangway, the slimes hot on their heels. The woman quickly withdraws the gangway and the slimes halt, some pulsing angrily on the dock, a few near the water, retreating as the waves inch toward them.

         "T-thank you..." Wendy manages to choke out while catching her breath. She looks at her rescuer. She seems to be a woman in her 30s. On her upper body, she's wearing nothing but a bikini top and on her waist it looks like the remains of a lab coat fashioned into a crude kind of skirt. The woman looks at the emblem on Wendy's arm, clearly visible now her jacket is gone and she's just wearing a sleeveless blouse.

         "So you're wizards, huh? The company must have sent you to find us," The woman says.

         "Yeah..." Wendy answers.

         "C'mon inside, you've probably got a lot of questions." Wendy and Carla follow the woman inside the boat. There are about six other women in there, all in various states of undress. One is in nothing but her underwear. Another is topless and has fashioned a head-rag into a makeshift tubetop. There is a young girl of about ten as well. Her pants have been reduced to mere short-shorts, and her t-shirt has been melted to well above her midriff, exposing her tummy fully. Clearly those monsters don't discriminate based on age. Which should be obvious, Wendy muses, as they went after her and it's not like she's started to develop yet either...

         "What happened here?" Wendy asks, her voice full of concern.

         "My name is Felicia Darrow. I guess you can say I was the lead on this project. All of us here are employees of the Heart Kreuz fashion company. We had been on this island studying a pretty miraculous plant. It absorbed magic energy and took on a nearly fluid like substance. The idea was to turn the plant into a dye and put it in clothing. It was supposed to be like wearing water. We were certain it was going to be a hit. Then, about a week ago, two of our workers who had been looking for samples came across a cave and in that cave was something that looked like a very old tablet with ancient writing on it none of us could read. I told them to put it back and we'd send a note into an archaeology guild or something, but then...there was a blinding light and suddenly our samples started coming alive. They attacked us. Enrico, our mechanic, tried to fend them off, but they attached to him and burned him very badly." Felicia explains.

         "The man!" Wendy cuts in. "Is he hurt? Is he still here?"

         "Yes," Felicia says sadly, pointing to a bed at the far corner of a room. A grizzled looking man lies there, covered in bandages. Wendy rushes over to him to begin her healing spells.

         "I wish I could have tended to these sooner. It will be harder for him to recover, it having been so long," Wendy says, sadly.

         "Thank you, We are fortunate that you can help him, then. The stubborn old fool still keeps trying to get up to fix the ship. We tried to steer it out of here, but only Enrico knows how to steer it and we ran aground. In any case, the monsters burned Enrico. The women, though, they only tried to burn our clothes away. We ran for the boat, two carrying Enrico, me carrying my daughter, Sally, and we just made it. We were missing two of our workers but...they were right on top of us. We pulled the gangway away. Then..." Felicia's face falls. "One of the missing workers, Angeline, came out of the jungle, some of those things still attached to her. She was almost totally naked, save for a few scraps. Once the creatures finished those off they...they..." Felecia covers her daughter's ears. "They started...um...stimulating her...erm...erogenous zones." Wendy feels her face grow hot.

         'W-whaaat?" She says, disbelieving.

         "Y-yes, I was quite shocked as well. In any case, after Angeline couldn't...um...endure anymore more and...finished, the creature seemed to enter her. Then she...changed. She was Angeline, but...she looked like them now. Made of blue slime. And she started watching us like they did. They seem to be afraid of water for whatever reason. So it seems they want to...turn females into them, but they have to strip us totally naked to do so, and it also seems they can't pass water." Wendy looks pensively at the ground.

         "Well...what do we do now?" Carla asks.

         "Sadly, our choices are pretty limited. Either you and I go back to that island and try to figure out what's going on, risking the monsters, or..."

         "Or?"

         "Or you fly back to the mainland to get help. I'm not sure I can handle this on my own and this could be dangerous to a whole lot of people if no one knows what's going on," Wendy answers.

         "Absolutely not! If I'm flying back I'm taking you with me!"

         "No, Carla. Someone needs to stay and protect these people, and since I can't fly that someone has to be me. If you go back to the mainland you could warn the guild. I bet Natsu could burn these things to nothing, or Gray could freeze them in their tracks. And since they don't seem to like water, Juvia would be perfect too. And if we can recover that tablet, maybe Levy could figure out what this all means. Also, if you could bring a boat back here to moor close to the island, we could evacuate everyone."

         "I...I could fly everyone off the island one at a time..."

         "No, Carla. It's too far. You aren't strong enough, and if you collapse we'll lose the only means of contact we have."

         "But if I leave you'll be grounded with no way to fly! Those things might get you!"

         That was true. Wendy knows her choices are limited. She can either keep Carla here to explore the island and try to figure out the problem on their own with the benefit of flight. Or she could send Carla to the mainland for help. Finally, she might not be be able to evacuate everyone, but maybe one person...maybe the youngest. She could send Sally with Carla to keep her from harm, though this would undoubtedly slow Carla down, and likely make it take longer for her to get help.

         She has to make a decision.
132.title: On a job.

choices: Ask for help for a supply run to the island
1322.content:
"It's okay, Carla. I know you're worried about me, but we need help as soon as possible. These things could threaten a whole lot more people if they make it to the mainland. People need to be warned. And we need backup here. So please...go as fast as you can." Wendy says.

         "I...I will" Carla throws her arms around Wendy. "Please...be careful."

         "It's okay. I'm not the same weak girl I used to be."

         Wendy follows Carla outside. Carla assumes her cat form again and, with a last look at Wendy, soars into the sky and towards the mainland.

         "There she goes," Wendy says sadly. She returns inside to the rest of the women. "So...what now?"

         "Well...we've been living on this ship for the last week or so. It's not exactly comfortable, but knowing help is on the way will raise spirits a bit, at least" Felicia answers.

         "How are you for supplies here?" Wendy asks.

         "Well...truth be told we ran out of food on the boat yesterday. And our water filter appears to be broken..."

         "I see..."

         "How long do you think it will take for your friend to get help and come back?"

         "It's hard to say. Flying here is faster than sailing, that's for sure. And we have no food...or much water. Tell me...are there supplies at the camp?"

         "Yes, but..."

         "Food, water and clothes. Enough to last until Carla can make it back. Plus...if I can get that tablet I can take a look at it. Maybe I can figure something out. At the very least I'd have it to give to Levy if she shows up, so maybe we can know what to do before going in there."

         "It's too dangerous. You should just stay on the ship. It might be a little uncomfortable, but I think we can hold out until your friend returns." Felicia pleads.

         Wendy thinks. Once again, none of her choices are great. She can stay on the ship with everyone, hoping the monsters don't adapt somehow to attack them and also hope they can stretch their meager rations long enough for Carla to arrive with rescue. Or she could brave the island again, attempting to gather supplies, info and maybe that tablet to give them an edge. She supposed she could also ask if one of the girls was willing to help her and perhaps recover more from the camp.

Juvia Lockser wondered why fate was crueler than any Dark guild mage she had ever fought against... or with. It should be a joyous time for her since she was now on a well-paying mission with her beloved. There was just one snag.

Earlier that day, Juvia had stayed just ahead of Gray. She had learned that staying close by staying ahead of her true love made him less suspicious. She had it planned out that with nearly everyone already out on a mission, she would just need to wait near the board for Gray-sama to reach to pick a mission, she would simultaneously take it, and they would go together.

As she expected, Gray first talked to some of his guildmates. This included Cana, and Juvia thought they talked for too long; and was she jiggling her jugs at him! Granted, her attire would make most floozies blush, but bouncing busts should be forbidden near Gray-sama. Juvia's anger turned melancholy as she realized that another one of her nakama had become love rival.

"It looks like I just beat the storm," Lucy said as she entered the hall. Sure enough, thunder crashed and rain started to aggressively pour down.

"Drip drip drop," Juvia quietly said. Her mood rose quickly as Gray moved to the board. Using the stealth skills she had honed from staying by Gray, she sneaked over to the board. Watching his hand, she timed it perfectly. She closed her eyes when she felt their fingers touch.

"Oh, Gray-sama. Juvia guess we're fated to be together... on this mission" Juvia said softly.

"I guess that fair. Even with a three way split makes the mission worthwhile," answered a voice that was decidedly not Gray's.

Juvia opened her eyes and realized that not only had Gray and her grabbed the highest paying non-S-Class mission, but so had Lucy.

Juvia fumed. "Lucy, proposing three ways with Gray-sama? Unforgivable! No doubt you waited for Gray to reach for this mission so you could go on it with him, you devious seductress!"

Lucy started to return that anger as the storm outside intensified. "Geez, what's with you water girls? If anything, I grabbed the mission first, but it was close. And for not the first hundredth time, I'm not interested in Gray!"

"Ladies," Gray said, becoming concerned with how this would turn out, "I'm fine going on the mission with you two if you won't fight like to alley cats...."

Lucy nodded and offered her right hand to Juvia. Juvia looked at the red Fairy Tail stamp for a moment before accepting. She also didn't want the chance of Gray and Lucy going without her. "Juvia will share dearest on this mission and work with my friend and rival."

Gray and Lucy glanced at each other wearily, which they should have known was seen by Juvia as lustfully.

"Should we head for the last known location of the outlaws now or do some research and planning first," Lucy asked in a way that indicated she preferred the latter.

Gray shrugged and took off his shirt. "I don't think these two will be that strong, especially against the three of us. I vote for going."

Juvia was saddened again. She had arranged for a dinner with Gray before they left, but was sure how to do that now that they had a third wheel. A buxom, blonde babe of a third wheel at that.

Juvia was starting to second guess her conservative clothes again. She preferred to be modest, but since all her guildmates seemed to be shoving their cleavage into her darling's face, maybe more risque was the way to heat up her love's heart.

15.content:
Or was it one of these?

Mirajane Strauss
http://fairytail.wikia.com/wiki/Mirajane...
Though Mirajane may be most known throughout Fiore for her bikini-clad photo-spreads in Sorcerer Weekly, she is also one of Fairy Tail's strongest wizards, being one of the four currently in the guild to have achieved S-Class rank. Though normally very sweet and gentle-natured, Mirajane's magic is among some of the most destructive and feared in the guild, and woe to anyone who awakens that side of her. Like the rest of her siblings, she uses Takeover magic, which involves transforming her own body. Her particular brand of Takeover is called Satan Soul. Her love of her guild is perhaps only eclipsed by her love of her two siblings, whom she is fiercely protective of.

Levy McGarden
http://fairytail.wikia.com/wiki/Levy_McG...
One of Fairy Tail's brightest minds, what Levy lacks in physical strength she more than makes up for in intelligence. She is bright and cheerful and has gotten Fairy Tail out of more than a few scrapes using only a book and her wits. She is a bit self-conscious of her small stature and less developed body compared with some of her fellow guildmates, but she still has her fair share of admirers. Her magic is Solid Script. She writes words in the air and those works appear in real space and take on the properties of that word.

Cana Alberona
http://fairytail.wikia.com/wiki/Cana_Alb...
Known as Fairy Tail's heaviest drinker, Cana is laid back and fun-loving and nothing is more fun for her than kicking back with an entire barrel of wine. Though having failed to achieve S-Class five times, Cana has considerable latent potential within her, possibly due to her father, Gildarts, being Fairy Tail's strongest wizard. She utilizes card magic, throwing cards with various effects in battle. She is also rather adept at fortune-telling.

Lisanna Strauss
http://fairytail.wikia.com/wiki/Lisanna_...
Mirajane's youngest sibling, and thought dead for two years, Lisanna had actually been magically transported to a parallel world. When she returned she rejoined Fairy Tail and continued on much as she had before. Lisanna is sweet, like her sister, though lacking her sibling's hidden harder edges. Like all Strauss siblings, she uses Takeover magic. Her particular brand is Animal Soul, which allows her to take on characteristics of various animals to enhance her battle prowess.

info.brief_description: The women of Fairy Tail are finding it hard to keep their clothes on. What will happen?
info.description:
Fairy Tail is the most famous wizard guild in all of Fiore. Situated in the town of Magnolia, it is home to some of the country's strongest wizards and some of its most beautiful women, and there's plenty of overlap in that score as well. While they are certainly known for their capacity for destruction and their unfortunate habit of getting in to trouble, they are also known for their strong sense of duty, honor and loyalty.

         Lately, though. the girls seems to be getting in to even more trouble than usual. They seem to being having a hard time keeping their clothes on. What will come of these unfortunate situations? Maybe you'll find the answer inside. Maybe you'll create the answer yourself.

Rules For Additions:

1. No growth/shrink, bodymod or vore. Yeah, I know the setting has magic, but threads like that tend to distract from the ENF parts.
2. No scat/pee/diaper or anything related to bodily functions of that kind.
3. No gore, disturbing violence or death.
4. Sex is okay, so long as it has proper lead up. You can even do ecchi/hentai things like tentacles or some domming and even bdsm style situations are fine, if not encouraged. All I ask is that you keep the tone light/funny/sexy. Don't make it dark or disturbing. This is supposed to be an erotic comedy.
5. It's fine for the male characters to show up. This isn't going to be a girls-only story or anything. I think most of the POVs will end up being female (at least the ones I set up), but men are allowed in the story for sure.
